attributes.action: Have general elections before allowing party members to become prime minister
attributes.additional_details:
The direction of the UK in the world at present is uncertain and lacks strong leadership to guide it through.
The people vote a party in on its message, policies and most importantly for public opinion is its leader. We cannot allow whoever is chosen within a party to take the UK in the direction they feel right without the consent of the people.
attributes.background: I have always found it un-democratic and worrying that a member of the government may be nominated prime minister without the vote of the people once the current one stands down.  We would like to have a general election to nominate the next party to lead the UK under such circumstances.
